title: Workshop on Developing Computational Thinking Metrics in Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Learning computational thinking indicator development methods applicable to math education settings for current professionals (medical/legal/technical)

learning_goals: Derive five indicators of computational thinking suitable for mathematics learning by applying qualitative research methodologies
Explain the process of applying problem decomposition, abstraction, pattern recognition, algorithm design, and generalization techniques to solve mathematical problems
Design an assessment tool to evaluate computational thinking development stages by analyzing actual student response cases

resources: Mathematical Computational Thinking Test Item Set

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
